MemberSignature.Value: public static void SetField (this Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.IMutablePropertyBase property, string fieldName);
.method public static hidebysig void SetField(class Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.IMutablePropertyBase property, string fieldName) cil managed

Docs.param: The property for which the backing field should be set.
The name of the field to use.

summary.para: Sets the backing field to use for this property.

Backing fields are normally found by convention as described here: http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=723277. This method is useful for setting backing fields explicitly in cases where the correct field is not found by convention.

By default, the backing field, if one is found or has been specified, is used when new objects are constructed, typically when entities are queried from the database. Properties are used for all other accesses. This can be changed by calling .
